title: Antigua and Barbuda - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: On 23 December 2020, in Saint John's, Saint John, a lobby group protested in front of the police headquarters to demand justice for the killing of a man. [size=no report]
On 3 December 2020, in Saint John's, Saint John, pensioners protested outside the office of the PM over the non-payment of pensions. [size=no report]
Police Forces of Antigua and Barbuda (2014-)

Around 29 September 2020 (as reported), in Saint John's, Saint John, unknown individuals poured flammable liquid on the house of a police officer and set it on fire. It resulted in some damage to the house but the officer was able to extinguish it on time.
Christian Group (Antigua and Barbuda); Labour Group (Antigua and Barbuda)

On 24 August 2020, in Saint John's, Saint John, members of a Christian church picketed outside a funeral home over allegations that the church had benefited financially from the funeral home, which the church denies. The protesters were joined by former employees of the funeral home who were upset after having been fired. In total there were about 20 protesters. [size=about 20]

On 28 July 2020, in Saint John's, Saint John, scores of people gathered at the Parliament building to protest against the measures implemented in the country against coronavirus and the extension of the state of emergency until October. [size=scores]
Police Forces of Antigua and Barbuda (2014-)
On 10 July 2020, near New Winthorpes, Saint John, four men in army uniforms abducted a customs officer at his house. His body was found later that same day, killed by gunshots. 1 fatality.

On 3 June 2020, in Saint John's, Saint John, people protested against the transfer of a convicted murderer in front of the Fiennes Institute. The convict would be transferred to the Institute - an elderly home - due to his advanced age and health problems. [size=no report]

On 12 May 2020, in Saint John's, Saint John, dozens of nurses picketed with signs along the highway on International Nurses Day and in support of nurses worldwide during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=dozens]
Police Forces of Antigua and Barbuda (2014-)
On 25 April 2020, in Saint John's, Saint John, a man was heavily beaten by a police officer, allegedly for breaking a curfew as part of coronavirus prevention measures.
On 28 March 2020, throughout Antigua and Barbuda a state of emergency was declared and a curfew was imposed to prevent the spread of coronavirus.
On 17 February 2020 in St John_, health center workers protested demanding better working conditions, owed pay and improved resources. [size=no report]
On 04 December 2019 in St John_, former employees of a closed down supermarket picketed outside another one of the supermarket owner_ businesses, demanding their overdue payments. [size=no report]
On October 24, 2019, in Saint John's, over five thousand people marched, protesting against the current administration. [size=over 5000]

On October 13, 2019, in Saint John's, a man was shot and injured by two men outside his house. The man was a custom_ officer and part of a team investigating a $3 million customs fraud made public the week prior.
On April 12, 2019, residents of the Point and Villa areas in the city of Saint John's, Antigua and Baruda, barricaded a street to protest the eviction of a neighbor. [size=no report]
On March 7 2019, protesters took the streets of Saint John's, Antigua and Barbuda to protest the current administration of the country. [size=no report]

On February 28 2019, members of the United Progressive Party staged a protest at Heritage Quay in the city of Saint John's, Antigua and Barbuda against a recent deal the government made with international cruise port developers. [size=no report]

On February 25 2019, family members of a young man that died under suspicious circumstances protested outside of the entrance of Jolly Harbor, Saint Mary, Antigua and Barbuda as they demand answers from the government. [size=no report]

On February 8 2019, staff and residents of a senior citizen facility in Saint John's, Antigua and Barbuda, for the second day in a row, staged a protest against the poor conditions in the facility. [size=no report]
On February 7 2019, staff and residents of a senior citizen facility in Saint John's, Antigua and Barbuda, staged a protest against the poor conditions in the facility. [size=no report]
Labour Group (Antigua and Barbuda); ATLU: Antigua Trades and Labour Union

On 28 December 2018, in Saint John's, Saint John, after being on strike for a week, workers at the state media associated with the Antigua Trades and Labour Union protested outside of the ABS Radio and Television office to demand the outstanding overtime pay owed to them. [size=no report]
Labour Group (Antigua and Barbuda); Journalists (Antigua and Barbuda); ATLU: Antigua Trades and Labour Union

On 20 December 2018, in Saint John's, Saint John, workers at the state media including journalists associated with the Antigua Trades and Labour Union protested outside of the ABS Radio and Television office to demand the outstanding overtime pay owed to them. [size=no report]
Labour Group (Antigua and Barbuda); ATLU: Antigua Trades and Labour Union

On 27 November 2018, in Saint John's, Saint John, almost 200 workers of the post office associated with the Antigua Trades and Labour Union walked off the job and started protesting outside the building. Due to rain the office has been without electricity and workers are complaining about mould in the work floor. [size=almost 200]
ATLU: Antigua Trades and Labour Union; Labour Group (Antigua and Barbuda)

On 26 November 2018, in Saint John's, Saint John, more than 200 postal workers affiliated to the ATLU: Antigua Trades and Labour Union in Saint John's, Bermuda, took the streets to protest the lack of electricity at the postal office. [size=more than 200]
Labour Group (Antigua and Barbuda); ATLU: Antigua Trades and Labour Union

Around 16 November 2018 (as reported), near Saint John's, Saint John, quarry workers represented by the Antigua Trades and Labour Union gathered outside the Bendals Quarry and protested to demand the overtime pay that their employers promised them. [size=no report]
Labour Group (Antigua and Barbuda); ATLU: Antigua Trades and Labour Union

On 30 October 2018, in Saint John's, Saint John, workers associated with the Antigua Trades and Labour Union of the Central Planning and Housing Authority walked off the office and protested outside the office after an Executive Officer faced discipline sanctions and was escorted by police off the compound for unknown reasons. The workers ceased their protest and returned to work after a short period of time following promises to address their concerns. [size=no report]
Labour Group (Antigua and Barbuda); ATLU: Antigua Trades and Labour Union

On 5 September 2018, in Saint John's, Saint John, at least 50 workers of the State Insurance Company associated with the Antigua Trades and Labour Union protested to obtain a salary increase. They were promised one by the Ministry of Labour but they found it not sufficient. This was the third and last day of protest. [size=at least 50]
Labour Group (Antigua and Barbuda); ATLU: Antigua Trades and Labour Union

On 4 September 2018, in Saint John's, Saint John, several dozen workers of the Antigua and Barbuda Social Security Board associated with the Antigua Trades and Labour Union protested for the second day in a row for the resignation of a manager who was accused of sexually harassing an employee who had rejected his advances. [size=several dozen]
Labour Group (Antigua and Barbuda); ATLU: Antigua Trades and Labour Union

On 4 September 2018, in Saint John's, Saint John, at least 50 workers of the State Insurance Company associated with the Antigua Trades and Labour Union protested to obtain a salary increase. They were promised one by the Ministry of Labour but they found it not sufficient. This was the second day of protest. [size=at least 50]
Labour Group (Antigua and Barbuda); ATLU: Antigua Trades and Labour Union

On 3 September 2018, in Saint John's, Saint John, several dozen workers of the Antigua and Barbuda Social Security Board associated with the Antigua Trades and Labour Union protested for the resignation of a manager who was accused of sexually harassing an employee who had rejected his advances. [size=several dozen]
Labour Group (Antigua and Barbuda); ATLU: Antigua Trades and Labour Union

On 3 September 2018, in Saint John's, Saint John, at least 50 workers of the State Insurance Company associated with the Antigua Trades and Labour Union protested to obtain a salary increase. They were promised one by the Ministry of Labour but they found it not sufficient. [size=at least 50]
ABLP: Antigua and Barbuda Labour Party

On 22 August 2018, in Saint John's, Saint John, more than 50 people picketed outside of the office of a law firm to show support for a former Labour female politician (ABLP). The law firm is representing the government in several on-going court cases against her. The protesters ask for a settlement of the case, which has been delayed and which the protesters see as unfair. The politician was accused of fraud. [size=more than 50]

On 16 August 2018, in Saint John's, Saint John, 19 people with physical disabilities protested in the parking lot of a shopping center. The protesters prevented people from parking in the regular parking spots to attract attention to people without disabilities parking in the spots reserved for disabled people. [size=19]

On 4 July 2018, in Parham municipality, fishermen protested against police officers occupying the Fisheries complex on the island, blaming them for not being able to get the complex up and running for the lobster season, which started on 1 July. The police have occupied the complex since hurricane Irma in September 2017. [size=no report]

On 1 July 2018, in Parham municipality, scores of fishermen protested at the Fisheries complex. The complex is being occupied by police officers since September 2017, preventing the fishers to earn a livelihood. [size=scores]
Labour Group (Antigua and Barbuda); ATLU: Antigua Trades and Labour Union

On 15 June 2018, in Saint John's, Saint John, about a dozen employees of a marketing firm affiliated with the Antigua Trades and Labour Union walked off their job and protested outside of the office building over dissatisfaction with a number of issues including unpaid back-pay and a leak in the office's roof. They also accused the general manager of being disrespectful and demanded her dismissal. [size=about a dozen]

On 6 June 2018, in Saint John's, Saint John, a handful of UPP supporters protested outside of the High Court in support of a member of their political party who was on trial for a civil matter that day. [size=a handful]

On 1 June 2018, in Saint John's, Saint John, over 100 workers from the Antigua and Barbuda Port Authority marched to the office of the Prime Minister to protest against the management of the port by Drawing Telemaque. [size=over 100]
Police Forces of Antigua and Barbuda (2014-)

On 17 May 2018, in Saint John's, Saint John, a man who was in custody at the Police Station was badly beaten by a high ranking officer. The wounds he sustained were serious enough to require a transfer to the hospital. 0 fatalities.

On 11 May 2018, in Saint John's, Saint John, about 15 employees of the Ministry of Agriculture walked out and protested outside of the office of the ministry over poor working conditions. [size=about half of the 30 employees]
On 24 April 2018, in Saint John's, Saint John, about 100 people from Barbuda protested outside of the Parliament building against the repeal of the Barbuda Land Act. [size=about 100]
On 24 April 2018, in Saint John's, Saint John, a protest in support of the work of nurses took place. [size=no report]
ATLU: Antigua Trades and Labour Union; Labour Group (Antigua and Barbuda)

On 3 April 2018, in Saint John's, Saint John, approximately 300 postal workers affiliated to the ATLU: Antigua Trades and Labour Union in Saint John's, Antigua and Barbuda, protested in front of the general post office and refused to go to work, as the building is under construction which causes potential harm to their health. [size=approximately 300]

On 25 January 2018, in Saint John's, Saint John, health workers of the Clarevue Psychiatric Hospital protested outside Parliament building. They were angry over a lack of payment and bad working conditions. Workers had been striking for a week and a half before this. [size=no report]
